sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
Plain dealing or a fair vvarning to the gentlemen of the Committee for Union : in a letter intended to Alderman Foulks, to be communicated unto them accordingly at Gurney House, or elsewhere. / Written by a friend to the Parliament, City and kingdom, and for their vindication, is now published to the world. Adams, Thomas, Sir, 1586-1668.
8 p.
s.n.], [London : Printed in the first year of the Agitators raign, MDCXLVII. [1647]
A friend to the Parliament = Sir Thomas Adams, whose initials appear as A.T. on p.8. The union referred to in title is between Parliament and the City of London. Imperfect: significant bleed-through. Annotations on Thomason copy: "By maior Tho: Adams"; "Nou: 17 1647". Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
=======

Adams, Thomas, Sir, 1586-1668.
8 p.
s.n.], [London : Printed in the first year of the Agitators raign, MDCXLVII. [1647]
A friend to the Parliament = Sir Thomas Adams, whose initials appear as A.T. on p.8. The union referred to in title is between Parliament and the City of London. Imperfect: significant bleed-through. Annotations on Thomason copy: "By maior Tho: Adams"; "Nou: 17 1647". Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
>>>>>>> imprintparse
